Articles.Content: I figured out that the system crashes immediately after it loads the color scheme for the first star. The next line of code is half-written and then the thing crashes.

1 hour ago, R3dst0ne_Warri0r said:

Okay, the executable itself isn't working properly. I'm on Windows 10, and it's all stored on a 2TB hard drive I installed recently. I got one star to load, but it looks pretty broken and none of the planets that were supposed to load did. I ran this test on both .95 and .96- .95 is the one that got a star to load in the first place. I asked the program to generate one star, two planets, with one moon each. It only generated the star, as previously mentioned.

Here are the screenshots:

https://imgur.com/Wadngkc

https://imgur.com/hJ3gCw6

The program won't generate that exact value, but will only generate up to as many as you specify. You can specify minimum planets/moons in the setting.py file.


And for the second image, it looks to be a bugged corona, Check if InfiniteDiscoveries/Textures/Misc/None.dds exists in your install
Finally, where did you install the mod from, was it spacedock or github?

Hey, I’m away from my PC at the time. it did the same when i tried to generate 100 stars prior, where it would only generate one or two. Is the program supposed to just shut down when it’s done, or is it supposed to tell me that it’s finished? That would help me figure out if it’s busted or if I’m just very unlucky.

13 hours ago, Sushut said:

Finally, where did you install the mod from, was it spacedock or github?

SpaceDock and Github gave the same results. I tried both 9.5 and 9.6 with galaxy from both platforms.

6 hours ago, R3dst0ne_Warri0r said:

Hey, I’m away from my PC at the time. it did the same when i tried to generate 100 stars prior, where it would only generate one or two. Is the program supposed to just shut down when it’s done, or is it supposed to tell me that it’s finished? That would help me figure out if it’s busted or if I’m just very unlucky.

Python is incredibly annoying where it doesn't print the error and instead completely closes the window. Also, did you run it inside the zip file? Not sure if that can actually be done though...
Anyway, best you can do is wait for the next update where I add a log to store all the errors in.

11 hours ago, Sushut said:

Python is incredibly annoying where it doesn't print the error and instead completely closes the window. 

Agreed. It turns out that ImageMagick wasn’t working, so i did the thing it told me not to do and set it to false in the limits script. 100 stars generated this way with 2-10 planets and 0-5 moons won’t kill me, eh? Right?

On 3/28/2023 at 3:44 AM, R3dst0ne_Warri0r said:

Agreed. It turns out that ImageMagick wasn’t working, so i did the thing it told me not to do and set it to false in the limits script. 100 stars generated this way with 2-10 planets and 0-5 moons won’t kill me, eh? Right?

sounds perfectly reasonable
it's been generating for an hour with 20 stars

41 minutes ago, CatKing1179 said:

it's been generating for an hour with 20 stars

 

and how many planets? how many moons?
generator speed heavily depends on your pc's specs

New cool epic update guys!! Look at the changelog for more details, but here's a cool video to show most of it:

 

Edited April 10, 2023 by Sushut

Thank you for this mod, it's exactly what I was looking for. Back in 1.2 I used To Boldly Go, which stopped updating back in 1.9 and I sorely missed it. 

A couple extremely low priority requests.

#1: Integration with Kopernicus expansion continued-er's Wormhole's.

#2: City Lights on planets with Life.

I wholly expect none of these to come to pass, but I figured I'd at least throw them out there. 

Again, thank you for what I would nominate for Mod of the Year.

Edited April 11, 2023 by Ravenspetdragon
in the newest update of the mod it says ignoring what it happening?

When it is generating the solar systems could you you add a progress bar
Thanks
this video explains what color stars should be in ksp depending on there size and tempreture. you could make star colors based on it.

20 hours ago, Squirrelify said:

When it is generating the solar systems could you you add a progress bar
Thanks

A progress bar is essentially impossible with how the generator works. (it comes up with values on the spot.)
The closest would be an estimate, but the values vary so much that it's just straight up guessing.

20 hours ago, Squirrelify said:

in the newest update of the mod it says ignoring what it happening?

Can you elaborate?

i have to say, this mod is pog. and i found out that you can add onto the galaxies you create!

edit: if you do, PLEASE choose other inputs so you dont have copies.

can you please make planets 10 bigger in radius but 2.5 times less massive at the same time?

23 hours ago, Average_ksp_enjoyer25 said:

You NEED to add this to ckan

there's no point in adding this mod to ckan, you'd still have to manually open the folder to run the exe, then remove the folder containing the exe so that ksp can load

Now that's some hot stuff right there! Ever since To Boldly Go got abandoned I've been hoping someone would make a system generator like this. And this is already looking amazing!

I guess now KSP1 won't ever die, because even when every modder has retired and all existing planet packs have been played to death, we can just generate infinite new ones.

 

Has anyone tried this with Research Bodies already? I'm not sure if Research Bodies even *needs* configs for a system or if it would just default to start with everything hidden.

I guess now KSP1 won't ever die, because even when every modder has retired and all existing planet packs have been played to death, we can just generate infinite new ones.

 

Has anyone tried this with Research Bodies already? I'm not sure if Research Bodies even *needs* configs for a system or if it would just default to start with everything hidden.

i did not know something like research bodies existed, i'll have to try that with the next update now
So I installed "Infinite Discoveries" and my game is stuck on the loading screen. Any fix?

1 hour ago, BlackEyedPhantom said:

So I installed "Infinite Discoveries" and my game is stuck on the loading screen. Any fix?

 

did you delete the "GenerateSystem" folder?

also, at what part of the loading screen?

Edited April 28, 2023 by Sushut

10 hours ago, Sushut said:

did you delete the "GenerateSystem" folder?

also, at what part of the loading screen?

so step by step:

I extracted the "Infinite_Discoveries-0.9.7.1" in the game folder
got to "InfiniteDiscoveries" and ran "generate system" in the "GenerateSystem" folder and opened the game.
the loading is stuck at the very beginning saying "Updating Parts" in the loading bar.
then i exited and ran "generate system" again but this time in "InfiniteDiscoveries" folder and ran the game again and same result.

And i didnt touch anything else yet.
